trans-unit.source: Error messages for SQL Database client programs
trans-unit.target: Error messages for SQL Database client programs

trans-unit.source: For each error, this gives the numeric ID and the textual message. Feel free to cross-reference your own preferred friendlier error message text if you see fit.
trans-unit.target: For each error, this gives the numeric ID and the textual message. Feel free to cross-reference your own preferred friendlier error message text if you see fit.

trans-unit.source: This topic lists several categories of error messages.
trans-unit.target: This topic lists several categories of error messages.

trans-unit.source: Most categories are particular to Azure SQL Database, and do not apply to Microsoft SQL Server.
trans-unit.target: Most categories are particular to Azure SQL Database, and do not apply to Microsoft SQL Server.

trans-unit.source: In your client program you have the option of providing your user with an alternative message customized by you, for any given error.
trans-unit.target: In your client program you have the option of providing your user with an alternative message customized by you, for any given error.

trans-unit.source: Tip: Of extra importance is the section of transient fault errors.
trans-unit.target: Tip: Of extra importance is the section of transient fault errors.

trans-unit.source: These errors should prompt your client program to run the retry logic you design to retry the operation.
trans-unit.target: These errors should prompt your client program to run the retry logic you design to retry the operation.

trans-unit.source: The following table covers the connection-loss errors, and other transient errors, that you might encounter while working over the Internet with Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: The following table covers the connection-loss errors, and other transient errors, that you might encounter while working over the Internet with Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Transient errors are also called transient faults.
trans-unit.target: Transient errors are also called transient faults.

trans-unit.source: When your program catches a SqlException, your program can check whether the sqlException.Number value is a value listed in this section of transient faults.
trans-unit.target: When your program catches a SqlException, your program can check whether the sqlException.Number value is a value listed in this section of transient faults.

trans-unit.source: If the Number value indicates a transient fault, your program can retry establishing a connection, and then retry querying through the connection.
trans-unit.target: If the Number value indicates a transient fault, your program can retry establishing a connection, and then retry querying through the connection.

trans-unit.source: For code examples of retry logic, see:
trans-unit.target: For code examples of retry logic, see:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Client development and quick start code samples to SQL Database</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Client development and quick start code samples to SQL Database</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>How to: Reliably connect to Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>How to: Reliably connect to Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: Severity

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Cannot open database "%.*ls" requested by the login.
trans-unit.target: Cannot open database "%.*ls" requested by the login.

trans-unit.source: The login failed.
trans-unit.target: The login failed.

trans-unit.source: Resource ID: %d.
trans-unit.target: Resource ID: %d.

trans-unit.source: The %s limit for the database is %d and has been reached.
trans-unit.target: The %s limit for the database is %d and has been reached.

trans-unit.source:
For more information, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=267637.

The Resource ID indicates the resource that has reached the limit.
trans-unit.target:
For more information, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=267637.

The Resource ID indicates the resource that has reached the limit.

trans-unit.source: For worker threads, the Resource ID = 1.
trans-unit.target: For worker threads, the Resource ID = 1.

trans-unit.source:
For sessions, the Resource ID = 2.

Note: For more information about this error and how to resolve it, see:
• Azure SQL Database Resource Governance.
trans-unit.target:
For sessions, the Resource ID = 2.

Note: For more information about this error and how to resolve it, see:
• Azure SQL Database Resource Governance.

trans-unit.source: Resource ID: %d.
trans-unit.target: Resource ID: %d.

trans-unit.source: The %s minimum guarantee is %d, maximum limit is %d and the current usage for the database is %d.
trans-unit.target: The %s minimum guarantee is %d, maximum limit is %d and the current usage for the database is %d.

trans-unit.source: However, the server is currently too busy to support requests greater than %d for this database.
trans-unit.target: However, the server is currently too busy to support requests greater than %d for this database.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=267637</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=267637</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source:
Otherwise, please try again later.

The Resource ID indicates the resource that has reached the limit.
trans-unit.target:
Otherwise, please try again later.

The Resource ID indicates the resource that has reached the limit.

trans-unit.source: For worker threads, the Resource ID = 1.
trans-unit.target: For worker threads, the Resource ID = 1.

trans-unit.source:
For sessions, the Resource ID = 2.

Note: For more information about this error and how to resolve it, see:
• Azure SQL Database Resource Governance.
trans-unit.target:
For sessions, the Resource ID = 2.

Note: For more information about this error and how to resolve it, see:
• Azure SQL Database Resource Governance.

trans-unit.source: The service has encountered an error processing your request.
trans-unit.target: The service has encountered an error processing your request.

trans-unit.source: Please try again.
trans-unit.target: Please try again.

trans-unit.source:
Error code %d.

You will receive this error, when the service is down due to software or hardware upgrades, hardware failures, or any other failover problems.
trans-unit.target:
Error code %d.

You will receive this error, when the service is down due to software or hardware upgrades, hardware failures, or any other failover problems.

trans-unit.source: The error code (%d) embedded within the message of error 40197 provides additional information about the kind of failure or failover that occurred.
trans-unit.target: The error code (%d) embedded within the message of error 40197 provides additional information about the kind of failure or failover that occurred.

trans-unit.source:
Some examples of the error codes are embedded within the message of error 40197 are 40020, 40143, 40166, and 40540.

Reconnecting to your SQL Database server will automatically connect you to a healthy copy of your database.
trans-unit.target:
Some examples of the error codes are embedded within the message of error 40197 are 40020, 40143, 40166, and 40540.

Reconnecting to your SQL Database server will automatically connect you to a healthy copy of your database.

trans-unit.source: Your application must catch error 40197, log the embedded error code (%d) within the message for troubleshooting, and try reconnecting to SQL Database until the resources are available, and your connection is established again.
trans-unit.target: Your application must catch error 40197, log the embedded error code (%d) within the message for troubleshooting, and try reconnecting to SQL Database until the resources are available, and your connection is established again.

trans-unit.source: The service is currently busy.
trans-unit.target: The service is currently busy.

trans-unit.source: Retry the request after 10 seconds.
trans-unit.target: Retry the request after 10 seconds.

trans-unit.source: Incident ID: %ls.
trans-unit.target: Incident ID: %ls.

trans-unit.source:
Code: %d.

Note: For more information about this error and how to resolve it, see:
• Azure SQL Database Throttling.
trans-unit.target:
Code: %d.

Note: For more information about this error and how to resolve it, see:
• Azure SQL Database Throttling.

trans-unit.source: Database '%.*ls' on server '%.*ls' is not currently available.
trans-unit.target: Database '%.*ls' on server '%.*ls' is not currently available.

trans-unit.source: Please retry the connection later.
trans-unit.target: Please retry the connection later.

trans-unit.source: If the problem persists, contact customer support, and provide them the session tracing ID of '%.*ls'.
trans-unit.target: If the problem persists, contact customer support, and provide them the session tracing ID of '%.*ls'.

trans-unit.source: Cannot process request.
trans-unit.target: Cannot process request.

trans-unit.source:
Not enough resources to process request.

The service is currently busy.
trans-unit.target:
Not enough resources to process request.

The service is currently busy.

trans-unit.source: Please retry the request later.
trans-unit.target: Please retry the request later.

trans-unit.source: Cannot process create or update request.
trans-unit.target: Cannot process create or update request.

trans-unit.source:
Too many create or update operations in progress for subscription "%ld".

The service is busy processing multiple create or update requests for your subscription or server.
trans-unit.target:
Too many create or update operations in progress for subscription "%ld".

The service is busy processing multiple create or update requests for your subscription or server.

trans-unit.source: Requests are currently blocked for resource optimization.
trans-unit.target: Requests are currently blocked for resource optimization.

trans-unit.source: Query [sys.dmoperationstats](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn270022.aspx) for pending operations.
trans-unit.target: Query [sys.dmoperationstats](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn270022.aspx) for pending operations.

trans-unit.source: Wait till pending create or update requests are complete or delete one of your pending requests and retry your request later.
trans-unit.target: Wait till pending create or update requests are complete or delete one of your pending requests and retry your request later.

trans-unit.source: Cannot process request.
trans-unit.target: Cannot process request.

trans-unit.source:
Too many operations in progress for subscription "%ld".

The service is busy processing multiple requests for this subscription.
trans-unit.target:
Too many operations in progress for subscription "%ld".

The service is busy processing multiple requests for this subscription.

trans-unit.source: Requests are currently blocked for resource optimization.
trans-unit.target: Requests are currently blocked for resource optimization.

trans-unit.source: Query [sys.dmoperationstats](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn270022.aspx) for operation stats.
trans-unit.target: Query [sys.dmoperationstats](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn270022.aspx) for operation stats.

trans-unit.source: Wait until pending requests are complete or delete one of your pending requests and retry your request later.
trans-unit.target: Wait until pending requests are complete or delete one of your pending requests and retry your request later.

trans-unit.source: Note: Federation errors 10053 and 10054 might also deserve inclusion in your retry logic.
trans-unit.target: Note: Federation errors 10053 and 10054 might also deserve inclusion in your retry logic.

trans-unit.source: The following table covers the various errors you can encounter while copying a database in Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: The following table covers the various errors you can encounter while copying a database in Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Copying Databases in Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Copying Databases in Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following table covers the errors caused by excessive use of resources while working with Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: The following table covers the errors caused by excessive use of resources while working with Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: Maybe your transaction has been open for too long.
trans-unit.target: Maybe your transaction has been open for too long.

trans-unit.source: Maybe your transaction is holding too many locks.
trans-unit.target: Maybe your transaction is holding too many locks.

trans-unit.source: Maybe your program is consuming too much memory.
trans-unit.target: Maybe your program is consuming too much memory.

trans-unit.source: Maybe your program is consuming too much TempDb space.
trans-unit.target: Maybe your program is consuming too much TempDb space.

trans-unit.source: Tip: The following link provides more information that applies to most or all errors in this section:
trans-unit.target: Tip: The following link provides more information that applies to most or all errors in this section:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure SQL Database Resource Limits</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure SQL Database Resource Limits</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Error number
trans-unit.target: Error number

trans-unit.source: Severity
trans-unit.target: Severity

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: The database has reached its size quota.
trans-unit.target: The database has reached its size quota.

trans-unit.source: Partition or delete data, drop indexes, or consult the documentation for possible resolutions.
trans-unit.target: Partition or delete data, drop indexes, or consult the documentation for possible resolutions.

trans-unit.source: Session is terminated because you have a long-running transaction.
trans-unit.target: Session is terminated because you have a long-running transaction.

trans-unit.source: Try shortening your transaction.
trans-unit.target: Try shortening your transaction.

trans-unit.source: The session has been terminated because it has acquired too many locks.
trans-unit.target: The session has been terminated because it has acquired too many locks.

trans-unit.source: Try reading or modifying fewer rows in a single transaction.
trans-unit.target: Try reading or modifying fewer rows in a single transaction.

trans-unit.source: The session has been terminated because of excessive TEMPDB usage.
trans-unit.target: The session has been terminated because of excessive TEMPDB usage.

trans-unit.source:
Try modifying your query to reduce the temporary table space usage.

Tip: If you are using temporary objects, conserve space in the TEMPDB database by dropping temporary objects after they are no longer needed by the session.
trans-unit.target:
Try modifying your query to reduce the temporary table space usage.

Tip: If you are using temporary objects, conserve space in the TEMPDB database by dropping temporary objects after they are no longer needed by the session.

trans-unit.source: The session has been terminated because of excessive transaction log space usage.
trans-unit.target: The session has been terminated because of excessive transaction log space usage.

trans-unit.source:
Try modifying fewer rows in a single transaction.

Tip: If you perform bulk inserts using the bcp.exe utility or the System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy class, try using the -b batchsize or BatchSize options to limit the number of rows copied to the server in each transaction.
trans-unit.target:
Try modifying fewer rows in a single transaction.

Tip: If you perform bulk inserts using the bcp.exe utility or the System.Data.SqlClient.SqlBulkCopy class, try using the -b batchsize or BatchSize options to limit the number of rows copied to the server in each transaction.

trans-unit.source: If you are rebuilding an index with the ALTER INDEX statement, try using the REBUILD WITH ONLINE = ON option.
trans-unit.target: If you are rebuilding an index with the ALTER INDEX statement, try using the REBUILD WITH ONLINE = ON option.

trans-unit.source: The session has been terminated because of excessive memory usage.
trans-unit.target: The session has been terminated because of excessive memory usage.

trans-unit.source:
Try modifying your query to process fewer rows.

Tip: Reducing the number of ORDER BY and GROUP BY operations in your Transact-SQL code reduces the memory requirements of your query.
trans-unit.target:
Try modifying your query to process fewer rows.

Tip: Reducing the number of ORDER BY and GROUP BY operations in your Transact-SQL code reduces the memory requirements of your query.

trans-unit.source: For additional discussion of resource governance and associated errors, see:
trans-unit.target: For additional discussion of resource governance and associated errors, see:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure SQL Database Resource Governance</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure SQL Database Resource Governance</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following table covers the errors that you might encounter while working with federations.
trans-unit.target: The following table covers the errors that you might encounter while working with federations.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Managing Database Federations (Azure SQL Database)</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Managing Database Federations (Azure SQL Database)</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The current implementation of Federations will be retired with Web and Business service tiers.
trans-unit.target: The current implementation of Federations will be retired with Web and Business service tiers.

trans-unit.source: Version V12 of Azure SQL Database does not support the Web and Business service tiers.
trans-unit.target: Version V12 of Azure SQL Database does not support the Web and Business service tiers.

trans-unit.source: The Elastic Scale feature is designed to create sharding applications with minimal effort.
trans-unit.target: The Elastic Scale feature is designed to create sharding applications with minimal effort.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Elastic Scale, see <linkText>Azure SQL Database Elastic Scale Topics</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about Elastic Scale, see <linkText>Azure SQL Database Elastic Scale Topics</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Consider deploying custom sharding solutions to maximize scalability, flexibility, and performance.
trans-unit.target: Consider deploying custom sharding solutions to maximize scalability, flexibility, and performance.

trans-unit.source: For more information about custom sharding, see <linkText>Scaling Out Azure SQL Databases</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about custom sharding, see <linkText>Scaling Out Azure SQL Databases</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.target: Error number

trans-unit.target: Severity

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Mitigation
trans-unit.target: Mitigation

trans-unit.source: <statement> statement not allowed within multi-statement transaction
trans-unit.target: <statement> statement not allowed within multi-statement transaction

trans-unit.source: Check that @@trancount is 0 on the connection before issuing the statement.
trans-unit.target: Check that @@trancount is 0 on the connection before issuing the statement.

trans-unit.source: Database '%.*ls' does not exist
trans-unit.target: Database '%.*ls' does not exist

trans-unit.source: Check sys.databases for the database state before issuing USE FEDERATION.
trans-unit.target: Check sys.databases for the database state before issuing USE FEDERATION.

trans-unit.source: %s Syntax error near ‘%ls’
trans-unit.target: %s Syntax error near ‘%ls’

trans-unit.source: FEDERATED ON can only be used when creating tables in federation members.
trans-unit.target: FEDERATED ON can only be used when creating tables in federation members.

trans-unit.source: There is already an object named ‘%.*ls’ in the database
trans-unit.target: There is already an object named ‘%.*ls’ in the database

trans-unit.source: Federation name already exists.
trans-unit.target: Federation name already exists.

trans-unit.source: A transport-level error has occurred when receiving results from the server.
trans-unit.target: A transport-level error has occurred when receiving results from the server.

trans-unit.source: An established connection was aborted by the software in your host machine
trans-unit.target: An established connection was aborted by the software in your host machine

trans-unit.source: Implement retry logic in your application.
trans-unit.target: Implement retry logic in your application.

trans-unit.source: <statement> needs to be the only statement in the batch
trans-unit.target: <statement> needs to be the only statement in the batch

trans-unit.source: Ensure that no other statements are in the batch
trans-unit.target: Ensure that no other statements are in the batch

trans-unit.source: Could not CREATE DATABASE because it would exceed the quota of the server
trans-unit.target: Could not CREATE DATABASE because it would exceed the quota of the server

trans-unit.source: Expand the server db count quota
trans-unit.target: Expand the server db count quota

trans-unit.source: <statement> operation failed. Specified federation name <federation_name> is not valid
trans-unit.target: <statement> operation failed. Specified federation name <federation_name> is not valid

trans-unit.source: Federation_name does not comply with federation name rules or is not a valid identifier
trans-unit.target: Federation_name does not comply with federation name rules or is not a valid identifier

trans-unit.source: <statement> operation failed. Specified federation name does not exist
trans-unit.target: <statement> operation failed. Specified federation name does not exist

trans-unit.source: Federation name does not exist
trans-unit.target: Federation name does not exist

trans-unit.source: <statement> operation failed. Specified federation key name <distribution_name> is not valid
trans-unit.target: <statement> operation failed. Specified federation key name <distribution_name> is not valid

trans-unit.source: Non-existent or invalid federation key
trans-unit.target: Non-existent or invalid federation key

trans-unit.source: operation failed. Specified value is not valid for federation key name> and federation name>
trans-unit.target: operation failed. Specified value is not valid for federation key name> and federation name>

trans-unit.source:
USE FEDERATION: Use a boundary value that is in the domain of the federation key data type, or that is not NULL.

ALTER FEDERATION SPLIT: Use a valid value in the domain of the federation key that is not already an existing split point.

ALTER FEDERATION DROP: Use a valid value in the domain of the federation key that is already a split point.
trans-unit.target:
USE FEDERATION: Use a boundary value that is in the domain of the federation key data type, or that is not NULL.

ALTER FEDERATION SPLIT: Use a valid value in the domain of the federation key that is not already an existing split point.

ALTER FEDERATION DROP: Use a valid value in the domain of the federation key that is already a split point.

trans-unit.source: cannot be run while another federation operation is in progress on federation name> and member with id id>
trans-unit.target: cannot be run while another federation operation is in progress on federation name> and member with id id>

trans-unit.source: Wait for the concurrent operation to finish.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the concurrent operation to finish.

trans-unit.source: <statement> operations failed. Foreign key relationships in reference tables referencing federated tables are not allowed in federation members
trans-unit.target: <statement> operations failed. Foreign key relationships in reference tables referencing federated tables are not allowed in federation members

trans-unit.target: Unsupported.

trans-unit.target: <statement> operation failed. Foreign key relationships between federate tables must include the federation key column(s).

trans-unit.source: Unsupported
trans-unit.target: Unsupported

trans-unit.target: <statement> operation failed. Federation key data type does not match the column data type

trans-unit.target: Value specified for the federation key is not valid

trans-unit.source:
Value must be in the range that the connection is addressing.

If filtered, the federation key value specified.

If unfiltered, the range covered by the federation member.

trans-unit.target: The SID already exists under a different user name

trans-unit.target: The SID for a user in a federation member is copied from the SID of the same user account in the federation root.

trans-unit.target: %ls is not supported on %ls

trans-unit.target: The following table lists all the general errors that do not fall into any previous category.

trans-unit.source: <AdministratorLogin> is not a valid name because it contains invalid characters.

trans-unit.source:
Try modifying your query to process fewer rows.

Note: Reducing the number of ORDER BY and GROUP BY operations in your Transact-SQL code helps reduce the memory requirements of your query.

Note: Reducing the number of ORDER BY and GROUP BY operations in your Transact-SQL code helps reduce the memory requirements of your query.

trans-unit.source: Servername <servername> cannot be empty or null. It can only be made up of lowercase letters 'a'-'z', the numbers 0-9 and the hyphen. The hyphen may not lead or trail in the name.
trans-unit.target: Servername <servername> cannot be empty or null. It can only be made up of lowercase letters 'a'-'z', the numbers 0-9 and the hyphen. The hyphen may not lead or trail in the name.

trans-unit.source: The SQL Azure system is under load, and is placing an upper limit on concurrent DB CRUD operations for a single server (e.g., create database).
trans-unit.target: The SQL Azure system is under load, and is placing an upper limit on concurrent DB CRUD operations for a single server (e.g., create database).

trans-unit.source: The server specified in the error message has exceeded the maximum number of concurrent connections.
trans-unit.target: The server specified in the error message has exceeded the maximum number of concurrent connections.

trans-unit.source: Try again later.
trans-unit.target: Try again later.

trans-unit.source: The SQL azure system is under load, and is placing an upper limit on the number of concurrent server CRUD operations for a single subscription (e.g., create server).
trans-unit.target: The SQL azure system is under load, and is placing an upper limit on the number of concurrent server CRUD operations for a single subscription (e.g., create server).

trans-unit.source: The subscription specified in the error message has exceeded the maximum number of concurrent connections, and the request was denied.
trans-unit.target: The subscription specified in the error message has exceeded the maximum number of concurrent connections, and the request was denied.
